info.title: SourceCraft API
info.description: Bleeding edge of Public REST API of SourceCraft

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

delete.description: Permanently deletes a comment from an issue. This action cannot be undone.

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme
Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: do not notify subscribers

get.description: Retrieves all attachments from an issue

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme
Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

get.description: Gets attachment details and download URL

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

delete.description: Permanently removes an attachment from a comment. The file will be deleted and cannot be reused.

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

delete.description: Remove a reaction from an issue comment

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

post.description: Adds a reaction to an issue comment

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

delete.description: Removes links between issues by ID

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

get.description: Retrieves all attachments from an issue

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

get.description: Gets attachment details and download URL

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

delete.description: Permanently removes an attachment from an issue. The file will be deleted and cannot be reused.

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: creation options (query)

get.description: Retrieves comments for an issue

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The maximum number of issues to return. The service may return fewer than
this value

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
A page token, received from a previous call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters must match
the call that provided the page token.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Ordering options: comma separated list of fields. For example: "name, created_at"
Default sorting order is ascending. To specify descending order for a field,
append a "-" prefix; for example: "name, -created_at"
Redundant space characters in the syntax are insignificant. "foo, -bar", " foo , -bar", and "foo,bar"
are all equivalent.

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: do not notify subscribers

get.description: Retrieves links between this issue and other issues

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The maximum number of issues to return. The service may return fewer than
this value

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
A page token, received from a previous call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters must match
the call that provided the page token.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Ordering options: comma separated list of fields. For example: "name, created_at"
Default sorting order is ascending. To specify descending order for a field,
append a "-" prefix; for example: "name, -created_at"
Redundant space characters in the syntax are insignificant. "foo, -bar", " foo , -bar", and "foo,bar"
are all equivalent.

post.summary: Create Link between Issues (By Issue ID)
post.description: Creates a two-way relation from source issue to target issue of a specific type. Only one link can exist between two given issues.

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

parameters.description: Only drafts (unpublished) comments

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
A page token, received from a previous call.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Ordering options: comma separated list of fields. For example: "name, created_at"
Default sorting order is ascending. To specify descending order for a field,
append a "-" prefix; for example: "name, -created_at"
Redundant space characters in the syntax are insignificant. "foo, -bar", " foo , -bar", and "foo,bar"
are all equivalent.
Available fields: iteration, author_id, parent_id

get.summary: List Repository File Tree (By Repo ID)

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description:
Git reference (branch, tag, or commit SHA). If empty, the default branch (usually main) will be used.
Examples: `mybranch`, `tags:v1.0.0`

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path within repository to get the tree for. If not specified, returns the root tree

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.description: Whether to retrieve tree entries recursively. If false, only immediate children are returned

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The maximum number of tree entries to return. The service may return fewer than
this value

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
A page token, received from a previous call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters must match
the call that provided the page token.

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme
Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

Redundant space characters in the syntax are insignificant. "foo, -bar", " foo , -bar", and "foo,bar"

Available fields: name

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The maximum number of reviewers to return. The service may return fewer than
this value

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
A page token, received from a previous call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters must match
the call that provided the page token.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Ordering options: comma separated list of fields. For example: "name, created_at"
Default sorting order is ascending. To specify descending order for a field,
append a "-" prefix; for example: "name, -created_at"
Redundant space characters in the syntax are insignificant. "foo, -bar", " foo , -bar", and "foo,bar"
are all equivalent.

Available columns: created_at, decision

default.description: Both Client Errors (4xx) and Server Errors (5xx) are serialized into this scheme

parameters.name: revision

Git reference (branch, tag, or commit SHA). If empty, the default branch (usually main) will be used.

parameters.name: path

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.description: Whether to retrieve tree entries recursively. If false, only immediate children are returned

The maximum number of tree entries to return. The service may return fewer than
this value

the call that provided the page token.

AddRepoRolesBody.title: The request body specifies the users and their respective roles to be added to the repository

next_page_token.description:
A token, which can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

AddRepoRolesResponse.title: The response returns all roles and users from the repository

error_code.title: Error code that can be used for error handling. For example: "ValidationError"

details.title: Optional details. Exact structure depends on error_code

AutoAssignResponse.title: AutoAssignResponse contains information about all the reviewers of pull request

status_slug.title: Status. System-wide statuses: open, inProgress, paused, closed, declined, duplicate

label_ids.title: IDs of labels from this repository which are to be linked to the issue. Cannot be used with label_slugs

label_slugs.title: Slugs of labels from this repository which are to be linked to the issue. Cannot be used with label_ids

linked_pr_ids.title: IDs of PRs from this repository which are to be linked to the issue. Cannot be used with linked_pr_slugs

linked_pr_slugs.title: Slugs to PRs from this repository which are to be linked to the issue. Cannot be used with linked_pr_id. For example ["1", "2", "10"]

slug.title: optional, default slug is generated from name
optional, default slug is generated from name

fork_repo_id.title: Optional. Fork repository ID if creating PR from another repository

reviewer_ids.description: Optional. List of user IDs to assign as reviewers.

publish.title: Whether to publish the PR immediately (default: false = draft)

need_resolution.title: Indicates an issue in PR that must be resolved before merge

iteration.title: Optional iteration specification (defaults to latest iteration)

visibility.title: Repository visibility. Available values: public, private

templating_options.description: Create repo from template. If template is chosen, init_settings are ignored.

from.description: Start of commented region, line number (1-based).

to.description: End of commented region, line number (1-based).

outdated.description: Indicates whether commented region has changed after initial comment publishing.

org_slug.title: Organization slug where the fork will be created (use either org_slug or org_id)

org_id.title: Organization ID where the fork will be created (use either org_slug or org_id)

slug.title: Slug for the forked repository (up to 256 characters). If not specified, uses the source repository slug

default_branch_only.title: Copy only the default branch. If false, all branches will be copied

Hunk.title:
Hunk represent transformation that will modify region
in left side from_start:from_start+from_count into region
in right side to_start:to_count

default_branch.title: Repository default branch (up to 256 characters). Optional, "main" if omitted

create_readme.title: Whether to create README.md file with repository name and description

src_yaml_template_slug.title: The yaml specification template slug for launching ci

started_at.title: Timestamp when the issue was last moved to in_progress status

completed_at.title: Timestamp when the issue was last moved to completed or canceled status

link_type.title: link_type must be read as {sourceIssue} {verb} {targetIssue}: issue#1 is parent of issue#2

A token, which can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

RemoveRepoRolesBody.title: The request body specifies the users and their respective roles to be added from the repository

RemoveRepoRolesResponse.title: The response returns all roles and users from the repository

parent.title: Fork parent repository (only populated for forked repositories)

Role.title: Role selector for listing PRs related to a user

revision.title:
The branch or tag to run the CI workflow on. If empty, the default branch (usually main) will be used.
Examples: `mybranch`, `tags:v1.0.0`

workflow_revision.title:
The branch, commit hash, or tag to retrieve the CI configuration from. If empty, the default branch (usually main) will be used.
Examples: `mybranch`, `tags:v1.0.0`, `25ae02f94bef174fa7a44084908c6dda494862a9`

input.description: Input parameters to pass to the workflow. This can be a JSON object containing key-value pairs for workflow inputs.

trigger_status.title: Will always be equal to 'created', remains here for back-compatibility

review_decision.title: If no decision is specified, the existing one will be reset

SetDecisionResponse.description: SetDecisionResponse contains information about set decision and pull request id.

path.title: Full file path from repository root

Subject.title: A subject is an entity that can receive and use a role

SubjectRole.title: SubjectRole contains information about subject and his role

name.title: Name of the file or directory

status_slug.title: Change Status. System-wide statuses: open, inProgress, paused, closed, declined, duplicate

priority.title: Change Priority. Available values: trivial, minor, major, critical, blocker

assignee_id.title: Change Assignee, pass empty to clear

milestone_id.title: Change Milestone, pass empty to clear

visibility.title: Change Visibility. Available values: public, private

title.title: Change Pull Request title (up to 1024 characters)

default_branch.title: Default Branch. Must be an exisiting branch

UpdateReviewersBody.title: UpdateReviewersBody transmits the IDs of those users who need to be added as reviewers

UpdateReviewersResponse.title: UpdateReviewersResponse contains information about all the reviewers of pull request

WorkflowInput.title: WorkflowInput message is a list of key-value items to pass as input for workflow run

target.title:
For annotated tags: hash of the tag object
For lightweight tags: hash of the commit
